review_content:
33cl can shared with Kermis.
Clear golden pour.  Thin white head. Crap. Weak and watery

Bottle in Luoyang, China. Poured a crystal clear gold with a few mm of bright white open foam that diminished quickly to a blotchy cap that laced poorly. Carbonation virtually nil with rare coarse bubbles. Aroma of malt and rice; no obvious hops. Taste of grain and metal; no bitterness. Light body. Smooth, crisp and refreshing if cold. Very similar to many other Chinese pale lagers.

风格：Internation Pale Lager
酒精度：4.0%vol
原麦汁浓度：10.0°P
灌装日期：2016.12.10

饮用日期：2017.04.09

总体印象：加入糖浆的国际淡拉格，第一次喝的是北京产的。闻香麦芽味还挺突出，入口杀口感挺强烈，有一些辛辣感，酒花香气很微弱几乎感觉不到。
Ok macro lager. Probably better in summer than winter. Very watery with a bit of maltiness, yeastiness and bitterness. I’ve had worse but I’ve also had a lot better.

This IS the 4%, OK? Now, the only reason I still try these beers is the amusement with the sameness across an incredibly broad range. This is hardly offensive. Just tasteless and totally forgettable. Tick.
Skuffende. En øl med fornuftig alkohol-procent, men stadig noget tynd snask. Helt igennem kedelig

This was one of the weaker beers I’ve tried in China. Very flavourless and watery. A lively palate was the only thing it had going for it...that and the fact the weather is hot, so I’ll take anything. Bottle in Pingyao.

Backlog nov 2010 Shenzen
Light color & body & complexity
Refreshing, but not much flavor
Ok chinese industrial

Wieder ein chinesicher Witz, soll angeblich Bier sein. Man merkt, es wurde wohl Malz benutzt, muffig kommt dieser daher. Eine leichte bittere Note kommt im nachgeschmack durch. Der Mittelteil soll vermutlich hopfig sein, beschwören würde ich das aber nicht. Nö, muss nich sein. 	 
Test vom 20.11.2006, Gebinde: Dose 	Noten: 5,3,3,2,11,3 - 3,45
(Swigged from a 600 ml bottle)  Mouthfeel was dry and prickly. Taste was skunky, wooden, corn.
Can. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, rice. Flavour is fruit, malt, corn, rice , hop, grass. Boring beer.
Pours clear golden yellow with a small white head.Aroma hay and grass .Taste of malt ,hay and grass with some bitterness.Hints of cardboard.Thin body .Average lager.

Can. A pale golden beer, clear, and topped by a minimal white head. Grains, fruits and a mixed selection of unwanted aromas. Grainy flavor with fruityness. Actually a decent bitterness too. Thin body. Definately not a beer I would be content drinking all the time, but it’s not all bad. At least there’s some bitterness. 100618
Yellow colored, no head. Papery aroma with some perfumy-flowery tone. Thin to medium bodied, high carbonation. Flavor is even thinner with paper dominating, aftertaste has lemon and paper.

[Canned. Thx gnoff]
Pale golden. Brief, white head.
Pretty yeasty and with a bready maltiness.
Pretty thin with a low bitterness.
